segment.source: Instructions about how to create and configure shortcut preference extensions to file system objects, URLs, and shell objects.
segment.target: Instructions about how to create and configure shortcut preference extensions to file system objects, URLs, and shell objects.

segment.source: Group Policy, Shortcut Extensions, and Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Group Policy, Shortcut Extensions, and Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Group Policy, Shortcut Extensions, and Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Group Policy, Shortcut Extensions, and Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Group Policy includes the Shortcuts preference extension, which lets you configure shortcuts to:
segment.target: Group Policy includes the Shortcuts preference extension, which lets you configure shortcuts to:

segment.source: File system objects.
segment.target: File system objects.

segment.source: Traditional shortcuts that link to apps, files, folders, drives, shares, or computers.
segment.target: Traditional shortcuts that link to apps, files, folders, drives, shares, or computers.

segment.source: For example, linking a shortcut to an app from the Start screen.
segment.target: For example, linking a shortcut to an app from the Start screen.

segment.source: URLs.
segment.target: URLs.

segment.source: Shortcuts to webpages or FTP sites.
segment.target: Shortcuts to webpages or FTP sites.

segment.source: For example, a link to your intranet site from your employee's Favorites folder.
segment.target: For example, a link to your intranet site from your employee's Favorites folder.

segment.source: Shell objects.
segment.target: Shell objects.

segment.source: Shortcuts to objects that appear in the shell namespace, such as printers, desktop items, Control Panel items, the Recycle Bin, and so on.
segment.target: Shortcuts to objects that appear in the shell namespace, such as printers, desktop items, Control Panel items, the Recycle Bin, and so on.

segment.source: How do I configure shortcuts?
segment.target: How do I configure shortcuts?

segment.source: You can create and configure shortcuts for any domain-based Group Policy Object (GPO) in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: You can create and configure shortcuts for any domain-based Group Policy Object (GPO) in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: To create a new Shortcut preference item
segment.target: To create a new Shortcut preference item

segment.source: Open GPMC, right-click the Group Policy object that needs the new shortcut extension, and click Edit.
segment.target: Open GPMC, right-click the Group Policy object that needs the new shortcut extension, and click Edit.

segment.source: From Computer Configuration or User Configuration, go to Preferences, and then go to Windows Settings.
segment.target: From Computer Configuration or User Configuration, go to Preferences, and then go to Windows Settings.

segment.source: Right-click Shortcuts, click New, and then choose Shortcut.
segment.target: Right-click Shortcuts, click New, and then choose Shortcut.

segment.source: Choose what the shortcut should do, including Create, Delete, Replace, or Update.
segment.target: Choose what the shortcut should do, including Create, Delete, Replace, or Update.

segment.source: Type the required shortcut settings and your comments into the Description box, and click OK.
segment.target: Type the required shortcut settings and your comments into the Description box, and click OK.

segment.source: For more information about shortcut extensions, including step-by-step guidance, see Shortcuts Extension and Configure a Shortcut Item.
segment.target: For more information about shortcut extensions, including step-by-step guidance, see Shortcuts Extension and Configure a Shortcut Item.
